urn:contentItem:5V9F-HH81-F19S-P06J-00000-00Kokusai Kogyo completes 2.5-MW PV plant in Japan's Wakayama2019-01-29T00:00:00Z2025-09-16T17:00:33ZLexisNexisKokusai Kogyo completes 2.5-MW PV plant in Japan's WakayamaSeeNews

January 29 (Renewables Now) - Japan's Kokusai Kogyo Co Ltd, the energy arm of green infrastructure company Japan Asia Group Ltd (TYO:3751), or JAG, announced today it has completed a 2.5-MW solar plant in Wakayama prefecture.

Nanki ShirahamaSolar Way, as it is named, is located on a 34,408 sq m (370,364 sq ft) unused site at Naki Shirahama airport. The area was awarded by Wakayama prefecture through a public offering, the company said.

Construction started in April 2018 and the work was carried out by JAG Energy Co Ltd.

With about 14,300 solar panels supplied by Solar Frontier KK, the photovoltaic (PV) plant has an estimated annual power generation equivalent to the consumption of about 729 households. Its output is to be sold to local utility Kansai Electric Power Co Inc (TYO:9503).

urn:contentItem:5V4S-5MG1-F19S-P2CG-00000-00Ichigo switches on 1.5-MW PV plant in Fukuoka2019-01-07T00:00:00Z2025-09-16T17:00:33ZLexisNexisIchigo switches on 1.5-MW PV plant in FukuokaSeeNews

January 7 (Renewables Now) - Japanese real estate investor Ichigo Inc (TYO:2337) started today commercial operations of a 1.48-MW photovoltaic (PV) power plant in Fukuoka prefecture.

Named Ichigo Itoshima Iwara ECO Power Plant, the PV facility is comprised of 4,720 solar panels. It is expected to generate more than 1.647 million kWh per year, enough to meet the annual power demand of 450 local homes, the firm said.

Located on 58,743 sq m of land in Itoshima city, Iwara ECO is Ichigo's 40th operational solar plant in Japan. With this new addition, the firm's operational portfolio reaches 113.06 MW.

March 30 (Renewables Now) - Green infrastructure company Japan Asia Group Ltd (TYO:3751), or JAG, has secured a syndicated loan with NEC Capital Solutions Ltd in support of a 16.6-MW solar power project.

The photovoltaic (PV) facility is under construction in Sano city, Tochigi prefecture, the company announced today. NEC will lend JPY 2.8 billion (USD 26.4m/EUR 21.4m), which will be used to pay the cost for the development and construction of the plant.

The project is being developed by subsidiary JAG International Energy Co. It is to generate enough power to meet the annual demand of 5,220 households. Local utility TEPCO Energy Partner Inc, a unit of Tokyo Electric Power Company Holdings Inc (TYO:9501), will be the sole purchaser of the plant's output, JAG noted.

(JPY 100 = USD 0.94/EUR 0.76)

urn:contentItem:630K-WDP1-F12K-R1J8-00000-00PRM / CA-ESRI2021-06-24T00:00:00Z2025-09-16T17:00:33ZLexisNexisPRM / CA-ESRI

Esri, the global leader in location intelligence, today announced it is releasing for the first time ever a new high-resolution, 2020 global land cover map as part of the company's Living Atlas. The map was built using European Space Agency (ESA) Sentinel-2 satellite imagery, and developed using a new machine learning workflow teaming with new Esri Silver Partner Impact Observatory, as well as long-time partner Microsoft.

This press release features multimedia. View the full release here: https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20210624005176/en/

Esri releases first-ever high-resolution (10-meter), 2020 global land cover map (Photo: Business Wire)

The new map will be updated annually supporting change detection and highlighting planetary land changes, especially related to the effects of human activity. A consistent map of land cover for the entire world based on the most current satellite information, the 2020 Global Land Cover Map can be combined with other data layers for green infrastructure, sustainability projects, and other conservation efforts that require a holistic picture of both the human and natural footprint on the planet. Later this year, Esri and Impact Observatory will make this new land cover model available to support on-demand land cover classification, allowing the GIS community to create maps for project areas as often as every week.

"This is a critical year for climate action," said Jack Dangermond, Esri founder and president. "With the UN Climate Change Conference of the Parties (COP26) bringing international parties together to address a set of common goals, we are happy to do our part in making this map available to users that are working towards the health of our planet."

Users will also be able to manipulate the map in association with other GIS layers such as terrain, hydrology, and more, all available in ArcGIS Living Atlas of the World, the foremost collection of geographic information from around the globe, including maps, apps, and data layers. Through the visualizations being released, planners worldwide will better understand the geography around them to make more informed decisions-enabling them to gain insight into locations with distinctive land cover, as well as human activity affecting them.

High-resolution, open, accurate, comparable, and timely land cover maps are critical for decision-makers in many industry sectors and developing nations. These maps improve understanding of important topics such as food security, land use planning, hydrology modeling, and resource management planning. In addition, national government resource agencies use land cover as a basis for understanding trends in natural capital, which helps define land planning priorities and is the basis of budget allocations.

Impact Observatory, contracted by Esri, developed a deep learning AI land classification model using a massive training dataset of billions of human-labeled image pixels, and applied this model to the Sentinel-2 2020 scene collection, processing over 400,000 Earth observations to produce the map. The unique machine learning approach used to create this global map will soon be available on demand, supporting land managers who need to monitor change in a specific area of interest, looking at annual change and seasonal differences in land cover.

"Global efforts are urging world leaders to set and achieve ambitious conservation targets," said Steve Brumby, Impact Observatory co-founder and CEO. "With support from the geospatial experts at Esri, and access to incredible compute resources at Microsoft, we were able to build in record time a land cover map that provides leaders in governments, NGOs, and across industries with a novel, timely view of the planet, and a new AI-powered capability for actionable, science-based insights on demand. In doing so, Impact Observatory hopes to contribute towards the global conservation effort."

Esri is releasing this valuable resource under a Creative Commons license to encourage broad adoption and ensure equitable access for planners creating a more sustainable planet. This content will be made available in ArcGIS Online as a map service and be freely available for use by its 10 million users. It will also be available for download and viewing. To explore the new 2020 Global Land Cover Map, visit livingatlas.arcgis.com/landcover.

About Impact Observatory

Impact Observatory is a mission-driven technology company bringing artificial intelligence (AI) powered algorithms and on-demand data to sustainability and environmental risk analysis for governments, non-profit organizations, companies, and markets. Founded in 2020 in Washington, DC, Impact Observatory's goal is to empower global decision-makers to be planetary superheroes, with the timely, actionable science-based insights they need to succeed. Visit us at impactobservatory.com.

About Esri

Esri, the global market leader in geographic information system (GIS) software, location intelligence, and mapping, helps customers unlock the full potential of data to improve operational and business results. Founded in 1969 in Redlands, California, USA, Esri software is deployed in more than 350,000 organizations globally and in over 200,000 institutions in the Americas, Asia and the Pacific, Europe, Africa, and the Middle East, including Fortune 500 companies, government agencies, nonprofits, and universities. Esri has regional offices, international distributors, and partners providing local support in over 100 countries on six continents. With its pioneering commitment to geospatial information technology, Esri engineers the most innovative solutions for digital transformation, the Internet of Things (IoT), and advanced analytics. Visit us at esri.com.

urn:contentItem:5PHR-4281-F19S-P17F-00000-00Japan's JAG completes 15-MW PV plant in Gunma2017-09-20T00:00:00Z2025-09-16T17:00:33ZLexisNexisJapan's JAG completes 15-MW PV plant in GunmaSeeNews

Sep 20 (Renewables Now) - Green infrastructure company Japan Asia Group Ltd (TYO:3751), or JAG, announced today it has completed work on a 15.4-MW solar power plant in Gunma prefecture.

Named Tsumagoi Solar Way, the photovoltaic (PV) plant is located in Tsumagoi village. The PV facility was developed by the firm's energy arm JAG International Energy Co Ltd.

Tsumagoi Solar is estimated to produce enough power to meet the annual demand of 4,900 local homes. The PV farm covers an area of 220,000 sq m and uses solar panels supplied by Canadian Solar Inc (NASDAQ:CSIQ). The engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) works were carried out by Toko Electrical Construction Co Ltd, the firm noted.

Back in August, JAG completed a 1.3-MW solar plant in Hokkaido prefecture.

urn:contentItem:5PDD-XX21-JDVR-007J-00000-00Ichigo completes 43-MW PV plant in Gunma2017-09-05T00:00:00Z2025-09-16T17:00:33ZLexisNexisIchigo completes 43-MW PV plant in GunmaSeeNews

Sep 5 (Reenewables Now) - Japanese real estate investor Ichigo Inc (TYO:2337) said today it has started commercial operation of a 43.34-MW solar power system in Gunma prefecture on Saturday.

The Ichigo Showamura, as it is named, comprises 166,716 panels and can produce around 55.43 million kWh per year, enough to meet the annual demand of 15,300 households. Completed four months ahead of schedule, this facility is the largest solar power plant in whole Kanto region, the firm said.

Spreading over an area of 854,340 sq m, Showamura is Ichigo's 34th operational photovoltaic (PV) plant in Japan. With this addition, the company now has a combined capacity of 100.44 MW in the country.

Тogether with its yieldco vehicle Ichigo Green Infrastructure Fund Investment Corp (TYO:9282), Ichigo has a total of 128 MW in 43 solar power plants in its Japanese portfolio, either in operation or under development, the company noted.

urn:contentItem:5P7S-XBP1-JDVR-00NC-00000-00Ichigo completes 2.9-MW PV plant in Hiroshima2017-08-14T00:00:00Z2025-09-16T17:00:33ZLexisNexisIchigo completes 2.9-MW PV plant in HiroshimaSeeNews

Aug 14 (Renewables Now) - Japanese real estate investor Ichigo Inc (TYO:2337) said today it has started the commercial operation of a 2.87-MW solar power system in Hiroshima prefecture on Friday.

The Ichigo Sera Aomizu ECO Power Plant, as it is named, comprises 10,848 panels and can produce around 3.34 million kWh per year, enough to meet the annual demand of 920 households, the company said.

Spreading over an area of 40,484 sq m (435,766 sq ft), Sera Aomizu is Ichigo's 33rd operational photovoltaic (PV) plant in Japan. With this addition, the company now has a combined capacity of 57.10 MW in the country.

Тogether with its yieldco vehicle Ichigo Green Infrastructure Fund Investment Corp (TYO:9282), Ichigo has a total of 128 MW in 43 solar power plants, either in operation or under development  throughout Japan, the company noted.

urn:contentItem:5R76-N7G1-JDVR-044X-00000-00Japan's JAG starts construction of 17-MW solar plant in Tochigi2017-12-20T00:00:00Z2025-09-16T17:00:33ZLexisNexisJapan's JAG starts construction of 17-MW solar plant in TochigiSeeNews

December 20 (Renewables Now) - Green infrastructure company Japan Asia Group Ltd (TYO:3751), or JAG, said today it has broken ground on a 16.6-MW solar plant in Japan's Tochigi prefecture.

Scheduled to start operations in March 2019, the photovoltaic (PV) plant should be able to produce enough power to meet the annual demand of 5,220 local homes.

The project is being developed by the firm's energy arm JAG International Energy Co, while the engineering, procurement and construction (EPC) works will be carried out by three local companies.

Located in Sano city, the plant will cover an area of 180 hectares and will use solar panels supplied by Japanese module manufacturer Solar Frontier KK. Local utility TEPCO Energy Partner Inc, a unit of Tokyo Electric Power Company Holdings Inc (TYO:9501), will be the sole purchaser of the plant's output.

Back in September, JAG completed a 15.4-MW solar plant in Gunma prefecture.
